description: Change of use of Arches 2-8 Bohemia Place to flexible commercial (Class E (a),(b), (d) & (g)(iii)) and Drinking Establishment (Sui generis) uses plus external alterations to arches 5-6 including new arch infills.
decision_conditions:
<p>No customer shall be on the premises other than between the hours of:
</p><p>10.00 until 00.00 - Monday to Saturday</p><p>11.00 until 22.00 - Sundays and Bank Holidays</p><p>REASON: To protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers and the surrounding area&nbsp;</p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>All new works in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance.

</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure a satisfactory external appearance.</p>

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the use hereby permitted, and notwithstanding the details on the drawings and
documents, a delivery and servicing plan for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the
local planning authority. Those details shall include:</p><p>i. How deliveries and general servicing will be managed;</p><p>ii. Waste management and collection strategy
</p><p>Servicing shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details upon commencement of the use hereby
permitted and for the lifetime of the development.</p><p>REASON: To ensure that that servicing and management of refuse will be appropriate in the interest of protecting
the amenity of the site, safety of the highway and the area in general from litter, odour and potential vermin/pest
nuisance.</p>

<p>No cooking of food shall take place on site until details of a fume extraction and filtration system have been
approved by the Local Planning Authority and implemented in full. Those details shall include an ongoing
maintenance plan for the fume extraction and filtration equipment. The approved fume extraction and filtration
equipment shall thereafter be retained and maintained in working order for the duration of the use in accordance
with the approved details.
</p><p>REASON: To protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers and the surrounding area as regards odour, fumes and
noise.</p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The floorspace shown on the approved plans to be used for Use Class E purposes shall be used for Class E purposes only and for no other use of the Town and Country (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification). Furthermore, notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) the floorspace within Use Class E shall not change use by any means under the Town and Country (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).&nbsp;</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-473591fa-7fff-8e70-faa4-89d6320fad2d"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: To enable the local planning authority to retain control of the use and to ensure that other uses are not introduced without further assessment.</span></p>
